info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 10:50AM CDT until September 24 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, San Saba.
* WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.75 inches of rain have fallen in the last 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Saba, Algerita, Cherokee, Chappel, Sloan, Bend, Harkeyville and Us-190 Near The San Saba-Lampasas County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1030 crossing Wallace Creek, CR 340 crossing Dry Creek, CR 424 crossing Rough Creek, CR 340 crossing San Saba River, County Road 343 crossing Cherokee Creek, County Road 432 crossing Cherokee Creek and CR 208 crossing San Saba River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
